summary_comment: Professor Lubomira is known for challenging exams that require thorough preparation, including reviewing slides, MasteringBiology, and attending lectures and TopHat sessions. While some students find the class manageable with diligent study and engagement, others describe it as difficult and criticize her teaching methods and exam structure. Overall, the class offers opportunities for extra credit and PLTL sessions, but these do not significantly alleviate the workload or difficulty of the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lubomira is known for challenging exams that require thorough preparation, including reviewing slides, MasteringBiology, InClassActivity, and TopHat questions. Her lectures are fast-paced, and while attendance is not mandatory, engagement through tools like TopHat is crucial for earning points.

Ratings.comment: Exams are difficult but doable if review all the slides, MasteringBiology, InClassActivity, TopHat. TopHat questions will be doable if you attend lectures and listen. PLTL is a 100% offered full and free credits and will be fun if you love debating and 2 drops for absence. Extra credits are easy to gain. Lab quiz is doable if review the lab manuals

Exams are difficult but it is doable, review slides, MasteringBiology, tophat, and InClassActivities. PLTL is interesting for people who like debating, points are easy to get and 2 drops for absence. TopHat questions will be easy to get correct once you attend lectures. Lab quiz will be doable if you read through the lab manual and 1 drop.

Horrible! DO NOT TAKE HER! I never make reviews but I had to for her. She speeds through lectures giving you slides that briefly explain the concepts and although attendance is not mandatory for lecture she still made tophats, I was ok with the tophats but you only get the points if you got the questions right and they were such complex questions.

Exams are harder than lecture slides. Expects you to know the material before class, as TopHat questions are difficult and you only get the points if you are correct. Rushed through lectures. No curve on the final exam with a low D average. PLTL is a waste of time, it's easy points though. Not difficult material, but she makes it hard to get an A.

She doesn't always explain concepts well. While attendance isn't mandatory, she uses TopHat during lecture for points. There is a lot of extra credit built into the class. Exams are a huge part of the grade but aren't unbearable. Study using the textbook because that's where she pulls material from. She's a funny lecturer but her class is tough.
Expects you to know materiel when you come to class. Will use TopHat and you only get credit if you get it right

Terrible at conveying material and the exams don't really reflect the slides (plus the slides barely have anything on them). Study study study for the exams though and you should be fine. Lots of other points aside from exams though which really helps your grade. Big group project at the end so get a good lab group.

She taught this class with Professor Danhart. The hardest part was the lab because it kind of had strict grading. In lectures, they teach, ask a tophat question, keep teaching, and sometimes give in-class activities. Exams are based on lectures, tophat, and the activities. Exams basically determine your grade by the end, so study and you'll be fine

If you have to take this class, she is a great professor and really funny, makes lectures entertaining. Biology is not my thing so I didn't like it, but she is a good professor and the lab instructors were really great.

This course was okay it was very difficult for me trying to keep up. We had to do a final presentation and final exam. The TA's were a little difficult to work with, overall the class is okay. The lecture is not mandatory, but you should go for TopHat points they help in the end.

This class was very difficult for me. I had a difficult time with the professor and TA. The exams are super hard but the tophat extra credit helped. Do not skip lectures, you will probably need the extra credit

She was a great professor, we had 2 midterms before the final, she only graded attendance through the tophat questions and had 20 extra credit tophat questions, so you could miss a few. You were allowed to miss one lecture without documentation but more than that you need documentation or its an automatic fail. overall pretty good class. 1113>1110
Make sure to study the tophat questions before exams. They are tricky, but as long as you attend class and study you should be fine.

The labs and exams are the things that determine your grade the most, as well as the top hat extra credit. If you get a good TA you are lucky. The first exam was not bad, second did not go as well but the final made up for it, as well as the extra credit you get from top hat. I enjoyed this class, definitely requires alot of time outside of class.

Dr. C was a good professor. Her exams were extremely hard and this class took a lot of studying. The lab that goes with it can be terrible or great all depending on the TA you get!! If you have a bad TA transfer to a different lab section as fast as you can because lab will greatly impact your final grade.

Honestly her class was unnecessarily hard. I studied for 27 hours for an exam with all of her lecture notes and study guides only for none of it to be useful on the exam. You have to go to lectures because she uses TopHat worth points for attendance. I would never take her again if I had the choice but will probably have to retake it in the spring.

I do not know why she is rated so low, yes her lectures were very long, BUT she went into detail with her lectures. Her lectures, activities, and homework helped prepare me for the final exam which I got a 114/120, and I am someone who struggles with science. Great professor! The lab TA (Eric) is also amazing, hard grader though. Nothing but good!

Though the lectures were long, I think she did the best she could to keep the material engaging and gave us lots of opportunities to earn extra points in her class with TopHat. Be sure to read the textbook and use the study guides, those are super helpful! The most difficult part of the class was the labs because they were graded too meticulously.

The class isn’t hard but she’s basically the worst. Labs are busywork and she is probably the least helpful professor at the university. Nothing in lecture has anything to do w labs and she grades so harshly on things she says not to spend too much time on. So much homework for no reason, feels like she wants to make the class harder than it is

Dr. Cubonova was an okay professor. I thought that the lectures were boring and dragged on. There is a lab once a week and the labs were very hard and made up a good part of your grade. You have to show up to class for the tophat questions and LPs. There are 3 midterms (a final), weekly homework, pre labs and labs.

Honestly, if you do all the work in this class and study a bit for exams you can get an A. Showing up to lecture is important because theres lots of graded in-lecture questions, but the content isnt too heavy and theres lots of homework to offset lower exam grades. Shes a nice professor and if you do assigned work youre good.

I loved this class! There is one in lab a week where a pre lab has to be done before class starts. There are 4 exams, which were made so we didn't have to take two big exams, which is sooo nice. I really enjoyed this class, had a great TA, and it was a great science class for a non-STEM major.

honestly i didnt do the best in exams but between group projects, TopHat questions, lab, and i class activities, i got an 85 in the class. she is hard professor but she wants you to do well even if you dont think she does. i recommend going to lectures and then the next day, rewatching them and taking more notes on the slides. it does help a lot

I didnt like Dr. C at the beginning & honestly the exams were hard. HOWEVER, i reached out and asked for help and she was ready to help. go to office hours and ASK FOR HELP, and she will help you. if you dont do well on her exam, review it with her and ask her what she advises you change in your studying. all you have to do it ask. i love her now
lecture heavy, exams so hard. just not the best class.

Make sure that you are reading the book and taking good notes from it before or after the lecture. Start studying for exam at least 2 weeks prior if you want to get at least a B+ on them. Make sure that you get those tophat questions correct so you get a bonus at the end of the semester. It literally saved my grade.

I took this glass for one of my gen eds. Proffessor Cubonova goes moderately fast during lectures, which are online. She tries her best to answer questions but cant always. She does Tophats during lectures which are for a grade but you can get extra credit. My advice; study in advance, pay attention, rewatch lectures, study everything.

Tophat questions during every lecture so attendance is mandatory. Grades are topcoat questions and weekly quizzes. The exams are hard and you need to use more than just the study guide she provides to study. I recommend taking good notes and anything you do not understand in her notes, refer to the book to help understand it more.

She's an alright teacher. The TopHat questions will add up, so be sure to get them right. The exams are brutal, and you aren't likely to do great on them, so make sure to study a good bit in advance. Smartbook activities help, but half of the stuff in the book isn't used, and some things that aren't mentioned in the lecture will be used.
Over complicated everything. She skips a lot of material and expects you to know a lot prior to the class.

Super hard to understand, very rude during lecture. Exams are super hard and cover so much material. I was not the only one who struggled as many people in my class could relate to me. It could be because the prof wasn't used to teaching online, but this was the worst class I have ever taken.
Tophat quizzes and in class activities are important. She makes the content fairly entertaining. Her accent can be kind of thick but not bad.

This class was pretty hard but manageable. Start studying for exams early!! I cant stress that enough, you definitely cant cram for the exams. When studying, I would suggest just knowing everything off the slides and less of whats in the book. Her study guides are helpful but not all of the info on the study guide will be on the exam.

Sometimes she was a bit difficult to understand because of her accent. Study, study, study for her exams; they are difficult but manageable if you put the time in. Reading the book before class is very helpful in understanding her lectures. Go to class; she takes attendance on TopHat, and the lectures are somewhat helpful.

It is very possible to get an A in this class, but you will have to work for it. Powerpoint slides and reading the textbook are very helpful for doing well on the exams. There are 2 pretty difficult midterms and then a cumulative final at the end of the semester. Dr. Cubonova also uses TopHat, so it is beneficial to go to class to get the points.

This class isn't an easy A, but it's easy to get an A if you work for it. She uses TopHat, and you must have a certain number correct by the end of the year. Her midterms were pretty difficult, but I studied by reading the book and her lecture slides and did well. Weekly home and quizzes, but neither were too time consuming.

Attend class because TopHat is graded. Lectures were fast-paced but had all the info you needed for the exam, I recommend reviewing after class. Review tophats before an exam. Difficult midterms but pretty easy final. Study at least a week before an exam. I never used the book, but you need the access code for homework and quizzes.

Dr. Cubonova is a great professor who makes her lectures as interesting as she can. Exams are pretty difficult so dont wait until the last second to start studying. Her office hours were a great resource and she really cares about how her students are doing. Tophat is for points so I dont recommend skipping this class.

Cubonova is very organized and structured and makes the information easy to follow. Missing a lecture will make the class really difficult. I had her as a T.A. for lab and she was great. Super nice and really funny. Even though it was hard, I really enjoyed the class.

Attend her lectures and read the book. You will do great on her assigned homework. The difficult part is the lab and the exams. For the lab, be as thorough as possible and ask questions, ask questions, ask questions. They will help you as long as they know you're struggling. Her exams you must study early and study often.

This class was crazy hard. No way around it. Good luck if you have to take this class. The prof is nice and tries to make lecture interesting, but the exams are hard and worth most of your grade. Study for weeks before in order to pass, go to lecture, read your textbook

I love Dr. Cubonova as a professor and person, really cares about you and wants you to succeed. Class I thought was pretty hard for being a level under 1113, midterms are heavily weighted and pretty difficult, does tophat during lecture so you have to be there. She grades all labs and in class activities through one paper from your lab group

For an intro to bio class, it was actually pretty difficult. I think the load of information you need to know is a lot; therefore, making it seem extra challenging. Take good notes and study as much as possible for her exams. Make sure to do all hw and quizzes and get all points you can. She's super funny and really nice so thats a plus!!

This class was really challenging, but it taught me a lot of skills that I needed to learn being in my first semester of college. Dr. Cubonova really wants to challenge her students, but wants you to do well. She was always giving us encouragement and doing what she could to help us succeed.

She was an amazing professor, it is just a lot of information which is expected. Copy or print the lectures the night before and take notes on them during the lecture. She moves too fast to write it all down. Read the book and take notes in that too, then do the homework. It's a lot of notes but it is worth it, trust me

She was kind of hard to understand at times, but overall was a great bio teacher and knew what she was talking about. Read the book, go to class, work on in class activities before class, and do NOT begin to study the night before the exam because it is so much information.
Amazing professor! Worked super hard to make sure we got all the points possible, and was super interesting in lecture. Funny and organized and very helpful. Amazing teacher!

I really liked her, she was friendly and always made everyone laugh. I would recommend. Go to class, her material is difficult and I watched my lab partners not do so well because they skipped lecture all the time.

I had her as my professor the second half of the semester. The material for the second half of the semester, in my opinion, was the tougher half of the semester. However, she explained things very well and the in class questions and assignments helped my understanding in my opinion. Exams and other assignments were all fair.

Pretty good professor. I honestly preferred her to Ball, who was the other teacher I had for bio this semester. Her exams are very easy if you read the book and follow her lecture slides; they're almost all based on the textbook. Attend lecture, TopHat is for credit.

She was a pretty good professor overall. Sometimes kind of difficult to understand from her accent. She's really funny and kind. The exams are fair and pretty straight to the point. Teaches the material well.

Dr. Cubonova is a great professor who is very personable outside of the class. Read the textbook and attend all lectures as the class is very information heavy and exams are a mix of more analysis and synthesis type questions. She is always willing help especially in office hours. Study hard and a good grade is attainable.
Dr. Cubonova is kind and willing to help you outside of class if you need it, but you have to work for your grade.  You need to read the book and show up to class to do well.

Dr. Cubonova was a good and helpful but very difficult professor. If you can't put all of your time and effort into this one class, you won't do well. The number of exams was not worth the small class size. Also, I did not know her TopHat questions were graded right/wrong until they were graded, so don't take her if you like to skip class.

She has a very thick accent and you cant understand her. She goes super fast with her powerpoints and expects you to remember every little detail even if it wont be on the test or exams. Wouldn't recommend having her as your professor

summary_comment: Professor Campbell is widely perceived as having poor teaching practices, including extremely slow and unresponsive grading, lack of feedback, and a tendency to make exams and quizzes overly difficult and filled with trick questions. Students find her grading harsh and unfair, and some feel she prioritizes her class above others without sufficient justification. While she offers extra credit opportunities and is described as nice once students get to know her, the overall consensus is that her class is unnecessarily challenging and unsatisfactory.
summary_comment_short: Professor Campbell is widely perceived as an unfair and unresponsive instructor, known for taking excessive time to grade without providing feedback and creating challenging exams without adequate preparation materials. Students find her grading harsh and inconsistent, often feeling that the workload is disproportionate to the course credit and difficulty level.

Ratings.comment: She is a very unfair teacher. She takes over a month to grade and gives no feedback. She acts like she owns the world, believes her class is the most important. Someone needs to tell her this is unacceptable. I wonder if she sleeps peacefully knowing how unfair she is. We pay a lot and work hard on assignments, yet she shows no accountability.

Way to hard of a grader and too serious for a class that should be engaging and insightful. Do NOT take with Lousie Campbell. As a typical A student who gives effort, she grades unfairly and too serious.
Louise has horrible exams. They are tricky, and she does not provide enough content to perform well. She grades too hard for a 1 credit asynchronous class. Do not take a course with this instructor.
Her exams and quizzes are full of trick questions. She grades harshly and does not leave feedback. She has a PhD in chocolate.
Grades the activities so hard and for what? It's a chocolate science 1 credit class. Way harder than it should be
This is not an easy and simple GE to take, please do not waste your time.

Louise made this class a bit harder than it had to be. She claimed to be very thorough with grading, but sometimes it was unfair. She graded late into the semester (about 3 weeks in) which means if you were making changeable mistakes, it's likely you didn't notice. She does give extra credit and there's ways to bring your grade up

12 pre and labs, 10+ quizzes, tastings, and participation points are the main grades for the class. Lots of EC. The professor does give a lot of work but easier than many science classes. If you closely follow directions and work well with peers class will not be hard. Professor is a stickler about certain things but she is nice if you get to know
OMG she is so picky about everything.
enjoyed this class, teacher very knowledgable, teacher very happy to help, yummy food
She is not a good lecturer or grader whatsoever. Especially on grades she ignores several key parts causing students to lose points. Do not take her classes.

Professor is nice as long as you do your work and show up. She can be mean if you dont do what is asked. class in SP 24 had 10 choc sets, 4 quizzes open note, and 1 group project, and lots of EC. Class is a lot of work for 1 credit hour but it is fun and something different. Professor is nice so give her a chance before judging. likes the feedback

The class itself is mostly easy, but there are a few projects that either require you to purchase something or go somewhere. Her instructions are very blunt and require intense reading, so if you are not that great at English, don't waste your time taking this class. I didn't have to interact with her much, but the class was pretty simple overall.

I didn't personally have very many problems with her since I was good at understanding her instructions, even though they were confusing, but she made inappropriate comments and was just plain mean to other students. However, she does give lots of extra credit, so it's not too difficult to get a good grade in her class.

Dr. Campbell is the worst professor I have ever had at Ohio State. She is incredibly rude to you when you ask for clarification. She will fight with you until you just stop responding because she has such difficulties being wrong. She is not a nice person. Do not take this class. She's a tough grader and has too many assignments for a GE. Avoid her
Avoid at all costs.

She is way too intense for a one hour credit course. Too many assignments, quizzes, and the final project is way too over the top. I understand she's passionate about the topic, but she should not be teaching a 1 credit hour course. She can also be a little rude.

She is the worst professor ever. Does she know that nobody cares about her class, they just need that one credit? Why is a one credit class the most extra thing. She is strange and should retire. Her tests are hard, you have to be precise on everything. My Mondays were automatically ruined this semester due to the fact I had to see her face.

I have nothing really good to say about professor Campbell so get ready.  She yells at her students, completely unprofessional and gets upset easily she may kick you out of the class if you are trying to clarify something. If you make one mistake or ask a question in lab that does not satisfy her, she will yell at you in-front of the entire class.
It is really really really really really really really really and very very very very very very awful.

I've never seen a professor be such a mean person before.  NO contact, slow reply to your email, crazy quiz which needs to get answers from WHAT SHE SAID in the past class. It should be an easy and funny class until she taught it. Why did she make a class of level 1000+ series so hard? It's just an 1110 course! A painful experience for me.

This class is most accurately described as an english comprehension quiz that teaches how to format in microsoft word.

The instructions poorly written. 

All assignment instructions are frustrating to even read. The grading is terrible, I barely got an A. 

The quizzes are filled with irrelevant memory-based questions.

This is an easy class, don't let the bad reviews deter you. Some of the assignments might take some time to complete and may be tedious, but as long as you are keeping up and following directions, it is an easy A. Just make sure you scrutinize her syllabus and directions for more lengthy assignments because they are full of information.
This is such an easy online class if you don't start assignments a day before it's due.  She is very particular in her instructions so be careful with that, otherwise assignments are relatively easy.

Dr. Campbell's assignments are very detail oriented and her grading is the same. Some of the assignments ask you to highlight something or place a square shape around some words just to see if you're paying attention. You will lose points if you don't put your name dot number on her assignments. Some of her assignments will take 4-5 hours.

I took this class and at first, I was scared because of the rigid guidelines but guess what she is more forgiving than she leads on. Super organized, everything you would want to know is there. Weekly quizzes 4 attempts and open note? SIGN ME UP! You literally just need to do your work and communicate with her about any difficulties. No biggie.

Absolute dogwatter teacher!!!! She is so unorganized and takes me forever to find an assignment on her canvas page. She is so rude and her quizes are so long and specific (for no reason). She legit gives you no time to take the quizes. She is an absolute terrible teacher. Never take this class. I am warning you!!!!

Her quizzes are accumulative. She is very particular about how many words and bullet points on PowerPoint presentations. During my groups presentation she berated us in front of the class for something we later realized was in the lecture material and she taught. Would not recommend. Easy A if you can handle her awful teaching.

This course costs a ton of money. Professor requires you to purchase a $40 software for a project that is a large chunk of your grade. Smaller projects throughout the course also require you to purchase food items, sometimes even encouraging you to prepare food?? Expectations are so unrealistic.

This professor doesn't give a lot of work, BUT the work that she gives is tedious and honestly stupid. She is not organized, doesn't know how to use carmen very well and she rambles A LOT in her power points for no reason. The info is hard to understand and the project that you have to do is LONG and frustrating.

This is the most annoying class ever. She does not know how to use powerpoint to provide lecture materials. She types out papers as she thinks, and instructions for simple tasks are 8 pages long. She has no thoughts in her brain other than she is awesome
This class was awful do not take it. You are given one huge project that is ridiculous and time consuming. The project is absurd and takes days to complete. I do not recommend this course to anyone.
Fun, very passionate, understanding and very willing to give extensions, wants you to actually learn the material

Not only does Dr Campbell give you 4 attempts per quiz you can literally just look at the textbook. If you don't do your work your not gonna pass, but it's like that in every class. At the end of the semester she gave 15 extra credit points. This class is very you just do what your told and if you mess up take advantage of the like 50 EC points.
This class is the worst class I ever had. The the the the the the worst. Awful. She has pages and pages instructions, get ready to read, and this is very confusing. The worst experience for college
Not a fair grader. Lots of peers had issues with Louise

Atrocious. She is completely technologically illiterate, leaving the burden to try to understand her *online* course to you. She does not respect her students, and believes that being unnecessarily harsh is something to be proud of.
Well, Dr. Campbell is actually nice and as long as you read the material she gave carefully, it is not difficult to get an A.
If you answer the open question(every week essay) with another resource even though it comes from your own knowledge, you'll get a 0. Just run.
Dont choose this professor unless u wanna a Fail.
Just dont take her class! Run!

Campbell loves to take points off for no reason. Makes her grading criteria super weird (ex. specific margin sizes, specific header, etc.), and she is super uptight about it. She grades a subjective free response question as if there is only one right answer. Her office hours are at an absurd time on ag. campus. Makes this GE unnecessarily hard.

Dr. Campbell gives exams that test one line in multiple chapters of a textbook and tries to trick you on every question (averages are 75ish). Worst of all, she is SO MEAN. She indicated that the reason it took weeks to grade everything is because she was reporting so many people to COAM. Is COAM worth it for an online GE? Like the reviews say, RUN!

Clear instructions and helpful feedback on assignments. Always reminds you when there is a quiz/exam. Responds quickly to emails and was very understanding when I had a valid excuse for a late assignment. She really is interested in what she teaches. Use the book during exams and you will be fine! And start projects early, they take awhile.

Easiest Bio GE. 6 exams (basically like chapter tests), and a quiz every week. ALL ARE OPEN NOTES. You can have carmen open in another tab while taking the exam and all the information you need is there. Drops 2-3 lowest quizzes. 2 small projects over the semester, easy. She also sends reminders about all assignments day before/day of due date.

Just don't take her class. All she do is trying to give student a hard time and enjoy see them struggle with no help. Take a detour if you see her in your schedule. It's not too late. RUN!!!! RUN FAR AND DON'T LOOK BACK!!!!!!!!!!!

Extremely rude with no advice on improvement. She would rather degrade you than help you succeed. If you are a 4.0 science major that has many mentors at OSU and you receive 60% on her assignment, I believe that says something. Run far away and never look back.

Prof Campbell was passive aggressive and rude to students individually and in class announcements. Instructions were unclear and the work was much more difficult than it needed to be. She completely discouraged us from contacting her- even going so far as to specifically tell us not to email her or she would delete them. Do not take this class.

Professor Campbell was THE WORST! Her directions are never clear and specific and she has done badly at getting back to students with questions quickly. Her grading was really tough, it does not worth your stress! 0/10 would recommend. This is the truth, okay?

Louise Campbell was a professor that I was interested to see what her teaching style would be given her extensive background in the food industry. However, her chosen form of communication for this class was passive-aggressive announcements that often attacked students for asking questions. I have never felt less welcome in a class.

She even cannot give right and clear instructions, her email is longer than you think but with only a little useful information. She loves to send email or other notifies in midnight. The grader is bad, and she may try to grade your project depends on the final average score, very unreasonable. Do not take her class, please.
The rudest professor who never help you with your issues. Most of the professors at OSU are helpful and kind, but she isn't. I won't take any class which taught by her.

Louise Campbell is the most disrespectful and rude professor I have ever had. She treats the student like they are stupid and is extremely condescending. If you ask for any type of help whatsoever she will respond with agitated and snarky remarks. constantly complains that the students ask too many questions and is extremely unhelpful DO NOT TAKE
Never ever choose her class!!!. Students are not welcomed to get a good grade.
DO NOT take any classes with her, she thinks the only class youre taking is her class. Her instructions are very unclear on projects. She tries her best to be rude and disrespect to students.

Easy-ish class (the online usual), terrible prof. Most times she emailed our class she would be rude, disrespectful, and uncaring. She often had no regard for students' concerns and would constantly complain about getting emails from students no matter the topic even though constant emails from students is a given when running online classes.

Absolutely horrible, this class was the easiest A for all of my friends with all multiple choice exams. half of her exam points are extended response which she grades fully on opinion. Terrible professor. Did more work for this GE than my Engineering classes, get over yourself Louise its a GE.

summary_comment: Professor Kolluri is known for her rigorous grading standards, particularly through her TAs, who deduct points for minor issues and require extensive detail in assignments. While some students found the class manageable and fair, others described it as overly demanding and stressful, especially regarding the detailed requirements and the grading of asynchronous discussions. Despite the challenging aspects, Professor Kolluri was noted for her willingness to accommodate students' needs, such as reaching out about special learning needs.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kolluri is known for her rigorous grading standards, particularly through her TAs, who deduct points for minor details and inconsistencies. Students find the course challenging due to its emphasis on attention to detail, though some appreciate her efforts to accommodate special needs and offer extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment:
Not hard, but TA's grade harshly. If you don't answer every part of every question on assignments in excruciating detail, you'll lose massive points.

Also, it was not clear how many posts students were supposed to have on the first discussion (12), and therefore the majority of the class flopped it. She did offer extra credit to help with grades.

This professor and her TA's are awful graders and will nitpick everything you do. They will dock points for dumb reasons like not liking the way you organized something or not separating a paragraph. This is a GE and they treat it like it's the most important class in the world. She also questioned my SLDS accommodations. Horrible!!
Dr. K was good, she just wasn't very present this semester, and sometimes her TAs were kind of harsh with their grading.

This professor and her TAs grade like it's a 4000 course. The amount of attention to detail you need for an asynchronous food science course is ridiculous. Her TAs are insane and grade harshly. They need to loosen up and remember it is a 2000-level asynchronous GE

Easiest class I have taken at OSU. You get all the content at once and have until the end of the session to complete it. I could of finished the class in a week if I wanted to, but I finished it in 4 weeks. The homemade chocolate activity was a pain, if I couldn't go home to do it I don't know how I would of done it, you need access to a kitchen.

I took chocolate science fully online so had little to do with her, but she reached out to me when my slds accommodations came in and asked me to let her know if she could help me in any way for the class. I thought the class was interesting and fair.

Didn't really interact with the professor due to it being asynchronous and online, but the course itself was okay. Her grading varied in strictness for the three projects (be sure to explain your answers!) but the Carmen quizzes/tests were super easy.

Grades really harsh for a chocolate science course. The class has 3 activities that are extremely tedious which are reading chocolate labels, making chocolate, and tasting chocolate. She will expect a reason behind every answer you have so be ready to elaborate. However, she did give a 1% bonus at the end of the semester for those on the border.

Very well put together course. Professor Kolluri expects a lot from her students but she also cares a lot about her students and is willing to sit down with you and work out your problems. If you put in the effort she will go out of her way to ensure you have a good grade.

Prof is extremely rude and will insult intelligence over small mistakes like forgetting a small portion of an activity. Also, grades are extremely rough for a 1 credit class. If you take the class keep your head down and just do the work because you won't get anything good out of the professor.
There are amount of assignments to do which is very awful, and the graders are very bad.

Theres not many assignments other than the 5 question quizzes and the exams, but what you do have to complete is a little bit difficult and requires knowledge in the material. She offers a lot of opportunities for extra credit so getting an A in this class isnt too difficult. Dont waste time copying the notes and just listen. Strict but fair

Be warned: she grades tough. Even for a chocolate science course. She definitely wants some explanation to every single question you do on a worksheet- even if the question says it doesnt need an explanation. She seems nice though if I were to email her.

Lectures are extremely boring as she goes through slideshows for the entire hour and 20 minutes. She would also pick on random students in class to answer questions. The exams were very hard. I studied a lot and never got over a C on an exam. Doing good on other assignments save your grade. I was a little scared of her tbh.

Kolluri was a great professor. The course was difficult but she made it as easy for students as she could. You just have to put in the work for the grade. She whole-heartedly wants all of her students to do well. She answers all questions in and outside of class and gives options for extra credit. I highly recommend her for any class.
I took this chocolate class online and had a lot of fun, just make sure to do all the assignments and youll pass.

Everyone says that food science is hard; it really isnt... yes, you have to put in effort, pay attention in class, and do the required readings. But if you do these things, its an easy A. Not much studying or work outside of class. Most homework and assignments are grade boosters if you try. Prof really tries to engage and help students too.
This course could be a lot easier than it is. Too much work, too much memorization at a quick pace. A lot more work than my major courses.

Very hard to understand. Will not pass the class if you plan on learning from lectures. I rarely paid attention to her lectures (party because I could not understand) and had to teach myself 8 chapters the week before the test. Practically a self-taught class. Not too much homework at all though.
Chocolate Science is just a fun class that requires minimal work and is an extremely easy A. Hardest part was the three activities: read chocolate labels, make chocolate, and taste chocolate.

She was very knowledgeable & knew what she was talking about but I had a very difficult time understanding her. The tests were super hard & I studied for hours with 2 other people & still didnt do great. However she offered a lot of extra credit points (a lot you had to attend class to receive). She was nice & helpful but I wouldnt take it again

Kolluri is very knowledgeable in her field. However, I had difficulty understanding her at times. I learned a decent amount of useful info in her class however her exams require a lot of studying. The readings are the most helpful. Just know that some info in the readings are not covered in class and vice versa. A generous curve was given @ end.

I think online chocolate science is standardized, but I had her and it was a great class. Interesting and super easy. She sent us notifications to do each module when they were do, but other than that, not sure how much involvement she had in the course. Basically, she is a good option for chocolate science online so take it.

I have a serious language barrier with her and the exams are hard as hell. However, I am not suggesting people taking this course with Dr. Kolluri. Although she is a nice person and knowledgeable in her field.
This is the hardest online class I have taken, because the exams have questions that we have not learned yet in the lecture readings. She is a really tough grader.

The workload is not heavy but the lectures are very heavy. You have to pay attention in class in order to understand and use the posted slides/weekly readings. It is clear that she is very knowledgeable of the topic, however, I have a language barrier with her. She is an expert of the topic but her accent can be very difficult to understand.

TAKE THIS CLASS!! There is one weekly quiz a week and 5 exams, but everything on them are from the notes she gives you. There's also a food project, which wasn't terrible. You're also graded on 1 of 4 discussion questions, but you have to do all 4 because she doesn't say which one she is going to grade. Overall an easy GE, very easy grader

I took the online class for GE. The quiz questions are really specific and the food log project is overly tedious. Honestly a lot of work for an online class and is way too involved for a basic GE requirement. She acts as if we are all Food Science Majors.

It's an easy A if you have friends in the class too who you can take the exams and quizzes with. Otherwise I probably would've gotten a B. It's a reasonable class though. There's a food project that's kind of ridiculous and tedious but she's not that tough of a grader

summary_comment: Professor Heldman is generally seen as approachable and willing to help during office hours, though his lectures are often criticized for being disorganized and monotonous. Students find his exams reasonable but note that the course structure and grading can be inconsistent. While some appreciate his support and the opportunity to succeed through effort, others find the class dull and unengaging, with little interaction or detailed explanations from the professor.
summary_comment_short: Professor Heldman is known for his approachable nature and willingness to help students during office hours, though his lectures are often seen as disorganized and his technical knowledge is sometimes questioned. Despite this, many students find the course manageable if they stay engaged and seek additional support outside of class.

Ratings.comment: A lot of people give Dr. Heldman a low rating because he does not know technology super well and does not give exact answers for certain questions. He wants you to learn. Go. To. His. Office. Hours. He is a very nice person and will help you there, much more than other teachers. Exams are reasonable.

Lectures felt more like a series of unrelated talks than a structured course. Professors monotonous.  No rubric for grading labs can be anywhere from 1-10 pgs. Don't trust scores put in Canvas for your grade. Don't trust syllabus. For those interested in the food supply chain beyond plant equipment I would recommend exploring AEDECON 3105.

This is for FDSCTE 3400. This course was grossly disorganized and confusing, both in person and on Carmen. Different professors each week who clearly did not communicate with each other very well. Dr. Heldman mostly facilitated the course and he was condescending when lecturing and grading. I did not learn a single thing.

If you are willing to attend class, complete assignments, ask for help, and try your best, you will be just fine. You cannot slack in the class, but Dr. Heldman makes success attainable. He gives exams open note and allowed us to waive the final if we ended the term with an A. I learned so much in this class.

He's an okay professor. 3/4 of the class don't attend because everything is on the slides and textbooks and Dr. Heldman just repeats what's on them. You don't need the textbook because the homework questions are posted.
Had no interest in teaching at all, refused to do examples. Practice exams were nothing like the actual exams

Luckily the class wasn't all that hard, but he  didn't do much to make it any easier. A very boring class. I will admit that I learned some things, mostly from the powerpoints he provided that I studied on my own, not really from him.

He is not a professor that will keep you awake.  He is very boring to listen to.  He did allow us to use our notes on exams and his lab reports were very easy.  Though the labs were not actually based in product that are dairy products.

If you want a Dairy engineering class then this will be perfect for you but if you are looking for someone who will teach you hands on processing don't waste your time take fruits and vegetable !! He is a nice old man who tries but I just didn't feel like he had any passion or really interest in teaching the class...
I took dairy processing with him he was very boring and condescending.  I learned nothing in the class. Take any other food processing course if he's teaching it.

summary_comment: Professor Pascall is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, particularly in subjects like Food Packaging and Food Regulations, where he effectively organizes and delivers clear, well-structured content and enhances students' problem-solving skills. He is known for his accessibility and genuine care for student success, though some find his teaching style and grading criteria challenging at times.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pascall is highly regarded for his passion and dedication to teaching, delivering clear and organized course content that equips students with valuable problem-solving skills. His approachable nature and genuine care for student success make him an effective and supportive instructor.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Pascall is an excellent professor who is passionate about his subject area and about his students' success. The Food Packaging course content was very organized, clear and well delivered. He also equipped us with problem solving skills; and for that I am grateful. An excellent professor who genuinely cares and is always accessible to students.

Dr. Pascall taught the Food Regulations class very well. The course content was organized clearly and his experience with the FDA was extremely handy in teaching FST 5320. He provided the lecture notes for study materials. Anyone who attends and listens to his lectures regularly will get a good grade. I will definitely recommend his class.
great proff, lots of information to learn from him.

Dr. Pascall cares a lot about teaching his students. He teaches using multiple techniques in order to reach many students learning styles. His lecture topics build on each other through the semester which makes it necessary to keep up with the work to get a good grade. With all his straight-forward teaching approach, he is a very fair professor.

I loved Dr. Pascall! He truly does care about you learning and thinking for yourself. He realizes that some people in the class arent super enthusiastic about food packaging but inspires you to think for yourself because he wants you to be successful in the food science industry as a whole. I found creating my own study guides helped for exams!
A fair and honest teacher, is willing to work with students to ensure they understand the material. Would take his class again.

Dr. Pascall is a very boring lecturer. He does not know how to use Carmen and it's very hard to figure out exactly what he wants in his work. He often goes on tangents that are not related and his quizzes are difficult. Although it was during a pandemic, his class added unneeded stress that could have easily been cleared up if he were more specific

summary_comment: Professor Barringer is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and deep knowledge of her subject. Students appreciate her clear and engaging lectures, application-based activities, and challenging yet fair exams that foster a strong sense of accomplishment. While some find her classes demanding, many praise her professionalism and approachability, recommending her courses for those serious about mastering the material.
summary_comment_short: Professor Barringer is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and deep knowledge of her subject, making her lectures engaging and easy to follow. However, her exams are challenging and require a thorough understanding of the material, though students find them rewarding.

Ratings.comment: Genuinely one of my favorite classes I have taken at OSU. Lectures were easy to follow and explained very well and the activities during lecture were application-based and very helpful study material for the exams. Exams are no joke but doable, they require a deep understanding of the material discussed in lectures, so go to class and participate.
she is the best professor ever!
The best.Period.
hate this class

Smart, professional, witty and knows her subject well. Her exam questions are totally wierd, open ended and have multiple correct answers but for sure they make you think in all directions. You ll work a lot but it will pay off at the end when you get a sense of accomplishment. And don't be afraid to approach her with your arguments, she is fun.

I had Dr. Barringer for 101, 696, and 613.  You can't avoid having her for 696 if you're a food science major.  She grades tough, but fair.  You've got to know your stuff and not BS your way through assignments.  She comes off as unapproachable, but she's actually nice.  Just know what you're doing and you'll be fine.  I'd really recommend 613!
No Comments
Chocolate science was so fun! We got to eat chocolate, make chocolate, talk about chocolate, it was really cool.
One of the most fulfilling C's you will ever recieve

summary_comment: Professor Pohlschneider is known for her clear grading criteria and fair assessments, making her class manageable and suitable as an elective. However, the class requires significant in-person participation and access to a kitchen for assignments, which can be challenging for some students. Her organization and communication are generally strong, but the workload can be heavy for a one-credit course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Pohlschneider is known for her clear grading criteria and fair assessment, making her class manageable and mostly easy, especially compared to other courses like Caffeine Science. However, the class requires significant in-person participation and work, particularly for assignments that need to be completed in a kitchen, which can be challenging for students without access to one.

Ratings.comment: A very manageable class to take as an elective, even as a second session course. It's a bit annoying to buy some of the cooking items if you don't already have them, but grading criteria is super clear and most of the points are on participation.

She makes mistakes while grading assignments and quizzes and you have to go to her to fix them or else your grades will not reflect your effort. The lab assignment topics were not always taught in lecture. Go to class as lectures are not recorded and TAKE NOTES from lecture because she quizzes on specifics and things not always mentioned in slides.

Dr. Pohlschneider is an amazing professor and really cares about her students. I just don't recommend taking FDSCTE 1140-Kitchen Science if you live in a dorm or don't have access to a kitchen as every assignment is done in the kitchen. She grades fair and as long as you give effort there should be no issue.

Great class compared to Caffeine Science. Far easier and doable. You can work on the assignments with others taking the class, just have to do your own written portions. Mostly an easy A if you're looking for a 2 credit class.

This is a 1 credit class. I took the 2nd session class and there are 2 quizzes every 2 weeks along with 2-3 assignments. At the end of the semester (last 2 weeks) there were 3 papers all 2-3 pages. Way too much work for a 1 credit class. Not clear on rubric. Responds quickly to emails though.

Dr. Pohlschneider was organized and her expectations for students in this course were very clear. Not a very difficult class but a good amount of work for one credit hour. The posting of grades for class assignments often took a long time. Ultimately a good professor who communicated the course material very well.
Fun class, fun labs, TA's grade hard for no reason, but overall loved the class.
Three papers towards the end. A quiz every two weeks. Two projects that aren't too bad. A lot of work for a 1 credit class though.

She is a good professor and my course was not showing up this was for FST4597.02 and it was not hard work. It was a lot of work but it was not hard. You have to do a lot of writing but it is mainly opinion based.. You do learn a good amount but this is an easy class for the grade.

One of the easiest A's I've ever gotten from a college course. No lectures at all. Just read for 10 mins and you will be good for quizzes. The only thing that required some work was writing the papers almost every week. Good thing is that they were easy to write and the topics we interesting.
Caffeine science is a pretty easy class, several interesting papers to write, and great content. Seems like a bit of work for a one credit class, but well worth it if you're looking for an easy 'A'.
She has one of the easiest class yet she tries to grade like it's something important like calm down. It's just food.

She's rude in emails, giving unclear feedback. She addresses herself with Dr. (yk what that means). She tells you one thing in emails while her grading says otherwise (I asked her if blank would work for an assignment, she says yes, but when grading, the criteria for the blank specifically was 4/10). She tries too hard honestly. Still easy A.
I took the online version. Would say it is easy A.

Easy class, have 2 weeks to make 10 discussion posts, 3 short papers on recent events, 2 papers on movies, and a final paper on what you learned. Piece of cake just do the work and follow the requirements on how to write your papers

Dr. P is a great professor and one of the best the FDSCTE department has to offer. 2400 is not a difficult class. The material is straightforward, the project is easy if you split the work up with your group, and the labs are kind of fun. Sometimes the TA grading the pre labs was harsh, and some of the quizzes were all short answer. Put the work in

Mary did a great job teaching the class on chocolate's science and history. She made the class enjoyable by incorporating chocolate tastings and provided extra credit on the midterms and final. The science side of the class was a little more challenging than expected for a non-science major, but nothing overly complex.

The class itself is super easy but, in my opinion, it's a lot of work for a 1-credit class. You have 3, 2-3 page papers due throughout the course which more than I've have in some 3 credit classes. She makes you take your quizzes on a LockDown browser but you are allowed to use notes.

Great teacher, passionate about chocolate and it shows in class. You get to try different chocolates in class and she does a good job teaching the different topics around Chocolate. The midterm was surprisingly harder than I expected. Definitely put in a couple hours (2-3) for studying for the tests. Project was very easy. Fun class, fun teacher.

Dr. Pohlschneider was a great professor. She truly cares about her students and she tries to get to know you. She keeps her class interesting and her exams and pop quizzes are fair. There's a decent amount of work to do for labs but it's manageable if you stay on top of it. And you get to eat food in most of the labs! Would take her again.
Chocolate Science! Awesome class and easy A. Fun prof for a fun elective!

Chocolate science is a fun class, but I thought the prof was just okay. She does give a TON of bonus points, but the group project is absurd for a ONE-CREDIT class. Tastings are fun, though. Participate or she gets cranky. All lectures on powerpoints, but she does like throwing trick questions on exams.

I don't know about other classes, but in Chocolate Science professor Pohlschneider tried to make it fun although the information was honestly very boring. Overall, an easy and sort of fun class. She also offers a lot of extra credit

This was chocolate science. We tasted chocolate. Yes. Easy A. The good thing is she knows everyone is taking this class for fun so takes the class lightly. Exams are straight out of powerpoints. Take this class!

Mary Kay is such a good teacher! I might be biased because I love the subject of Food Science and Technology, but I really did learn a lot from her and I REMEMBER it too! Her quizzes and tests are detail-oriented, but pretty fair if you study. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you should go because she asks test questions about stuff from class.
Clear lectures, easy to follow, overall nice lady.

Her quizzes and tests are borderline ridiculous. I spend a minimum of 5 hours studying for each quiz (all worth 20 points and none are dropped) and I will still get 15/20. Quizzes are based off book reading and things that are SAID or TOUCHED ON in class. Thus, attendance is mandatory. A 12 point exam Q might be based on ONE SLIDE. That's not right

I really liked Dr. Pohlschneider. Lectures were easy and always posted online. Lab portion was fun. Only thing is, she uses text book material on the midterms/quizzes that we will never go over. But still ended up with an A!

This class was fairly easy and enjoyable. Pohlschneider is laid back and will answer any questions you ever have. This class was a good intro to food processing and I am prepared to move on to the next level.

The class was incredibly easy because it was all discussion-based, but that also made it equally annoying. There really was not much teaching involved, and what she did teach was more on a middle school level. There were several papers for the class (2 3-5pg, 2 1pg, and 1 7-10 pg), no readings, and 1 class presentation. It was all straightforward.
no comment.

summary_comment: Professor Waters offers a highly accessible and easy course with manageable workload and flexible deadlines, making it ideal for electives. The class is well-organized, featuring easy quizzes and quick activities, though some students note the necessity of the textbook can be costly. Overall, it is recommended for those looking for a straightforward, enjoyable learning experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Waters offers a highly accessible and manageable course that is well-suited for electives or GPA boosters. The course is organized and straightforward, with a focus on easy-to-complete quizzes, exams, and activities, though some students note the necessity of purchasing a textbook.

Ratings.comment: Super easy course. Bit of work occasionally but never anything overwhelming or unmanageable. Would recommend as an elective.

This is such an easy online class. Modules are due at different times in the semester, but you can do them all at once if you want. There are Quizlets already made to help with the quizzes, and the projects have different options and can be completed pretty quickly. I definitely recommend this for a graduating senior!

He likes for his students to try new things. I enjoyed the tastings so much! I also enjoy getting drunk so I'm so happy I took this class. Would recommend to all 21+ it is worth the money! (I am an alcohol connoisseur.)

Super easy class but be prepared to pay a steep fine for his textbook. Roughly 80 bucks for a 1 credit hour class. Worth it if you want a super easy 1 credit hour class though. Just don't wait until last minute to do the activities, or you could be in for a rough time.

Beer and Wine was a very fun and easy online asynchronous class. It is well-organized, and all of the quiz questions come straight from the short textbook readings. The class is interesting and Professor Waters makes it fun. For the alcohol-tasting projects, you can opt to do an alternative assignment that does not involve drinking.
Great GPA raising class! A lot of reading and quizzes, but they are easy. Activities are also quick and easy.
Nice chill class
Class was super easy. The entire class is quizzes, exams and activities that were very easy but you need the textbook to complete the quizzes.

Great Professor, the class is very interesting but you are graded by few things. The activities are easy but the exams are somewhat challenging. Class is not mandatory but take note to in class activities.

Offers lots of extra credit just for attending random classes (almost worth an entire test grade). Few grades but clear grading material so you know what to expect. He's a little awkward, but definitely a nice guy.
Take FDSCTE1120 for an easy A. Online everything. If you can use CTRL-F and drink then the class becomes even easier.

Took both Beer&Wine and Chocolate Science with Waters. Both easy, but the beer class seemed like tons of more work for only being 1 more credit than chocolate. Chocolate class 3 sections of quizzes/activities/an exam and beer class has 4 sections of them. For Beer class have to pay for online book/quizzes, annoying activities but get to drink.
Perfect way to finish my last semester. Activities were fun, and you get to drink for class. Also, this is the easiest A I could have ever imagined.
Incredibly easy class, he essentially tells you what to study word for word during his review class. Adorable southern accent and mannerisms.
Easiest class at OSU I took in 4 years. Its fun too. Great way to end your last semester. Take if you need more credits or want a GPA boost.
If you put a small amount of effort in, you can easily get an A. Would recommend this class as a GPA booster.

Professor Brian is a very understanding and great teacher. His lecture slides are shorter than other classes. Quizzes and exams are piece of cake if you study his lectures. Highly recommend taking him if you want to boost your GPA. Good luck :)
I thought this class was so fun! You get to make chocolate, and everything is pretty straight forward. Great class!

Dr. Waters was a fabulous professor. I enjoyed the material, the beerwine tastings (for those of us over 21), and he made the subject matter even more than possible. He was a great lecturer and was there when I had any questions. I recommend this class to everyone.
Do the readings. Handle HW and quizzes with care. Follow the instructions closely or you will lose points. Interesting materials! Like this course!
Class is easy and interesting material. Not much to this class, you can learn as much or as little as you want really.
The class is real easy but his directions are not very clear. He will penalize you for not following the unclear and ambiguous directions and you will not get a clear response back either
it was great. there was so much chocolate wine it was great.

summary_comment: Professor Vodovotz is known for her challenging and time-consuming teaching style, particularly in her survey classes where students spend a significant amount of time engaging with the material. While some students found the class content manageable if they had a good grasp of statistics, many commented on her unapproachable and sometimes biased demeanor, describing her as rude, disrespectful, and difficult to understand. Overall, her teaching approach seems polarizing, with some finding it valuable when approached outside of class, while others found it
summary_comment_short: Professor Vodovotz is perceived as having a challenging teaching style, often avoiding questions and coming across as biased and difficult to understand. Students find her class frustrating and unpleasant, noting her rudeness and disorganization, though some suggest she is more approachable outside of class.

Ratings.comment: I took a 0.5 credit hour survey class but spent bloody amount of time. Interesting.
Cons: Avoids questions, is sometimes biased, difficult to understand, not enough knowledge depth! Has an attitude...she really does Pros:???
No Comments

Dr. V really hated teaching this class--she actually said that the first day. I would highly recommend talking with her outside of class because she is completely different (nice, actually). The material isn't really difficult as long as you can remember your statistics fairly well.  I would also recommend keeping any Stats notes you have.

This class was fairly easy from a content standpoint.  However, the teacher is rude, disrespectful, and will treat you like a child.  She obviously has issues with young people. Not pleasant at all. If your phone rings..she will take it.  The most unorganized class ever. TA's were clueless.

SEI.Subject: FDSCTE
SEI.Class Name: Instrumental Analysis II Molecular and Spectral Analysis Techniques

SEI.Subject: FDSCTE
SEI.Class Name: Instrumental Analysis II Molecular and Spectral Analysis Techniques

summary_comment: Professor Kolluri's class primarily involves note-taking, which students find easy but monotonous. Despite this, she is described as a very nice professor who assigns lengthy but not overly difficult projects that are time-consuming. The overall class is considered good, with participation earning extra points, and thorough exam preparation recommended due to the fast pace of the course.
summary_comment_short: Professor Kolluri's class primarily involves note-taking, which students find easy but monotonous. Despite this, she is described as a very nice professor who assigns lengthy but not overly difficult projects that are time-consuming. The overall class quality is considered good, with participation earning extra points and thorough exam preparation recommended due to the fast-paced nature of the course.

Ratings.comment: Her entire class consists of taking notes which is easy but boring. She is a very nice professor but she assigned some lengthy projects throughout. While the assignments weren't that difficult, each one would be very time consuming. Overall, good class and participation gets you extra points. Also be sure to study for the exams the time goes quick.

summary_comment: Professor Elekes is widely regarded as having poor teaching effectiveness and a challenging classroom environment. Students consistently report feeling overwhelmed by the fast-paced lectures and the lack of clear guidance, leading many to advise avoiding her classes. While some note her interest in the subject matter and occasional humor, the overall consensus is negative, citing harsh grading and difficulty in understanding the material both in and out of class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Elekes is generally considered to be a challenging and unapproachable instructor, with many students finding her classes difficult to follow and overly fast-paced. Her lectures and assignments are often poorly received, and she is frequently criticized for harsh grading and poor communication, leading many to advise avoiding her classes altogether.

Ratings.comment: I took this class hoping for an easy gen-Ed that Id like (cause who doesnt like food)??? Its not the absolute worst but I wouldnt recommend it at all. You can definitely find a better option. Shes kinda rude if you approach her outside of class also.
She's honestly so rude but sometimes she's funny. She also has assignments and talks about how easy they are and they are really simple assignments but they are graded really harshly.
Karen is difficult to talk to, can be defensive and rude. Does not engage the students in a way that's conducive to learning, so get ready to self teach.

A SELF-STUDY class. The slides Karen gave us are horrible to recognize and I always don't what she is talking about in the class. This is my last semester, I don't know what's wrong with me to choose this class. AVOID HER PLEASE! You will never know what she is talking about and the graders for this class are also horrible.

She's the worst professor at OSU that I've had. She literally crams in everything in lecture, you don't even remember what she says because she goes too fast. She grades so hard, even if her assignments are easy. There's no point in taking this class because she makes you know so much in such little time.
Karen is funny and cares a lot about the topics, however tests do need to be heavily studied for. Not a hard GE but not a super easy one.
Worst professor I have had at OSU. She expects us to know every single term that ever comes out of her mouth. No clear guidelines in the class. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I thought she was an interesting professor. You can tell she is an outgoing person and is pretty funny. You should attend the lectures because she will add questions only learned in class. Not everything is interesting but that's the usual. Pretty easy grader for homework.

Do not take Food Science 2200.I studied for every exam and did the assignments to the best of my ability, but it was not reflected at all in my grade. She knows a lot about the subject of Food Science but NOTHING about teaching. She overwhelms you with information and will trick you on the review power points when determining what to study.
This class is a lot harder than to be expected. Lots of information, lecture heavy with anecdotals

Great teacher overall, very fair when it comes to grading. Going to lectures isn't required but its super helpful because she tells you what is important and what will be on the exam. I suggest making a quiz let for the exams because it is a very content-heavy course. If you try even just a little but you will get an "A"

This class is not a hard class if you go to the lectures and pay attention. There is way to much information presented, but due to GE requirements nothing can be done. Karen tells you what you need to focus your studying on and even provides an exam question a head of time in lectures. She also gave extra credit and curved at the end.

Karen made this class too hard for a GE. The tests were very specific and she was a tough grader. There wasn't any homework except for a couple easy projects which was nice but she graded the projects very harshly. Her lectures are very boring and she always goes off topic. Not the worst GE you could take but not the best.

A little surprised on how harshly other students rate her on here. She is not the best professor in the world, but the class really is not that bad. You don't have to show up to class and can simply study hard a night or two before and probably pull off a 85-90. My class was more interesting since we had this chick that always made weird comments.
She's rude and gives insanely detailed tests. She makes what is supposed to be an easy GE, your lowest grade. Take the online version.

GET OUT WHILE YOU CAN. I'm a good student who did well in this class and I think the professor is delusional about what is expected from students. She is the classic example of a professor who knows so much about her field she is disconnected from students and what they're capable of memorizing and learning.

NEVER take this class! The teacher is rude and unreasonable. I took this class expecting it to be easy but I ended up putting more work into this class than any of my major classes. She makes tests much harder than they need to be and then blames the students for studying. My advice is to avoid this terrible professor.

Two words: INFORMATION OVERLOAD. The issue isn't that the material is hard to understand, but the amount of information thrown our way is so astronomically large that you'll never know what to study for the exams. At times it seems as if she is secretly trying to trick us, there's no reason this class should have an average of a 71%

Definitely a very interesting class that also should be an easy A, you do have to study but if you go to class she gives the answers and she definitely does not try to trick you. Most of the topics covered are very easy but if you have any question at all she is very helpful. Definitely recommend!

HORRIBLE class.  This class stresses me out more than some of my major classes. The questions on exams are incredibly detailed and its none of the information she covers in class. she says she isn't trying to trick us but she totally is by the way some questions are worded.  WAY too much info on exams.

If you are reading this, do yourself a favor and don't take this class. Many walk in expecting a pretty easy Gen Ed for the credit, but I actually study HARDER and LONGER for this class than I do for my actual major classes. Exams are unreasonable and contain too much information.

Exam questions are specific. Tons of lecture material and readings so she could essentially ask anything and say it was 'covered'. Review sessions are not that helpful as questions have different details.  Averages are 70-71% for midterm 1 and 2 and she says oh the mode is 86 so everything is fine and average is low b/c you don't study...

don't EVER take this class if you are looking for an easy Gen Ed. Exams contain way too much information and the questions are too specific. All of the other assignments in the class aren't too bad though, otherwise I would HIGHLY advise you not to take this class for the sake of you G.P.A

Easy class. Offers extra credit and the exams are really easy no final. Only a few assignments, but they are longer assignments. Finished with a 98% super easy class average exam score a B/B+. Lectures are optional and gives a 30 minute review session during class before each exam which was pretty much the test.
She is always there for you
Went to 2 lectures, got an A.

One of the best professors at OSU! Her lectures and explanations are really clear, and you don't have to go to class, but it's really helpful to go. She will come up with exam questions in class. Her assignments can be time consuming, but they're not hard. Exams go over the major topics, and I never felt like she was trying to make us fail.

Teaches this class with mike mangino. She teachers much more than him (&shes better). No textbook. Puts all the powerpoints up on carmen so attendance isn't necessary, but it's very helpful. Not an easy A, you'll definitely do some studying, but attend class & you'll be fine. Great lady, not old.

She was a great teacher. Super helpful when approached. She knows most people are taking the class as a Gen Ed and helps you succeed. Attendance isn't mandatory, but is really helpful. She points out what's important and most likely to be on tests.
Very nice teacher and made the class interesting. There to help students if they need it. If you study for the exams you will do well.

The class was a joke and definitely the easiest biological science. Having said that, Karen was indeed a smoke show. I took a hybrid version of the course where her and Mangino both taught and she was much better than him. If you do poorly on an exam, you will do poorly in the class. If you study for the exams, you should ace it. Class is boring
Easiest course I have ever taken. Went to class maybe two times. Teacher is an absolute smoke show. Wish she taught more classes. Very nice lady, always there to help out

summary_comment: Professor Simons is highly passionate about his subjects, making his lectures engaging and dynamic. He is known for his energy and commitment to student understanding, dedicating significant time to answering questions in both class and lab settings. Despite the challenging nature of his courses, he effectively transforms the learning experience into an enjoyable and rewarding one.
summary_comment_short: Professor Simons excels in making his lectures engaging and passionate about the subjects, contributing to an energetic classroom atmosphere. He ensures students have ample opportunity to ask and receive thorough answers to their questions, transforming challenging material into an enjoyable learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Simons is passionate about the subjects he teaches and makes lectures interesting. He's energetic and gives ample time for students to ask questions and he will answer them thoroughly. The class and lab are hard but he makes them more enjoyable.
